page.title: 13FARMING WEST OF THE SEVERN
page.content: The land here is flat and around 52 meters high with gentle slopes towards the river.The land is open with some forest cover.The main crop is winter barley with a break crop of sugar beet every 4 years. It is farmed between the two farms of {Manor & Moor Ridding}two thirds of the grain produced is used for the feeding of dairy cattle of which Moor Ridding has 100.It also has 45 pigs and 350 sheep.This farm tries to be as self sufficient as possible with least capital as possible invested. The land was once quarried for sand and gravel.The sandy soils are not naturally fertile. To overcome this, waste from the local sewage works is ploughed into the fields{(NOT DURING {STRONG WINDS).}During dry summers irrigation is applied from the river producing higher yields than normal.
